data:
<educational_content>
# Practice & Reflect on Your Skills

## Essential Skills Resources

Before diving into the technical requirements for your Excel High School courses, it's important to ensure you have the fundamental digital skills needed for success. We've compiled some quick resources to help you review these essential skills:

### Video Tutorials

**Web Navigation Skills**
- [Basic Web Browsing Tutorial](https://www.gcflearnfree.org/internet101/getting-started-with-the-web/1/) (3:24)
- [Advanced Search Techniques](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oIMRpMYGgS0) (4:15)

**Email Communication**
- [Email Basics Tutorial](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gTJccJQ8Jq8) (5:32)
- [Email Etiquette for Students](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M_PZUKmEstI) (3:47)

**Office Suite Basics**
- [Word Processing Fundamentals](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eYT4Omlj0Tg) (6:23)
- [Creating Basic Presentations](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XF34-Wu6qWU) (5:12)
- [Spreadsheet Basics](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rwbho0CgEAE) (4:56)

### Downloadable Resources

[**Digital Skills Quick Reference Guide**](https://excelhs.org/resources/digital-skills-guide.pdf)
Our comprehensive tip sheet includes:
- Keyboard shortcuts for efficient navigation
- File management best practices
- Troubleshooting common issues
- Email formatting guidelines
- Document organization tips

## Self-Assessment

Take a moment to reflect on your digital skill comfort level. Being honest with yourself about areas where you might need additional practice will help ensure your success throughout your courses at Excel High School.

### Reflection Prompt

**Which skill feels least familiar? Note one action you'll take this week to practice it.**

For example:
- *"I'm least comfortable with spreadsheets. This week, I'll create a simple budget spreadsheet to track my expenses."*
- *"I struggle with organizing files effectively. I'll create a folder system for my coursework and practice saving files with clear naming conventions."*
- *"Email communication feels challenging. I'll draft three practice emails using proper formatting and etiquette."*

Take a few minutes to write down your response. This personal commitment to skill development will help you identify and address any potential gaps before they impact your coursework. Remember, these fundamental digital skills will be essential across all your courses at Excel High School, and strengthening them now will set you up for success.

If you identified a skill gap, consider spending 15-30 minutes each day this week practicing that specific skill. Small, consistent practice sessions are often more effective than a single long session.
</educational_content>
